intro: Sisymbrium berningeri, commonly known as the Berninger's wild mustard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species of mustard and cabbages. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed, and often covered in fine hairs. Sisymbrium berningeri is characterized by its slender, branching stems and is often found in open, disturbed areas.
